(T.) ― -b3- [tanaAwala $ayoy^FA He reached a thing; took it with his hand; handed it to himself;] he took a thing with the extended hand; (TK;) or simply he took a thing; took it with his hand, took hold of it; syn. A^axa*ahu: (K:) best rendered, he took, or reached, or reached and took, a thing, absolutely, or with the hand, or with the extended hand; and in like manner, with the mouth, as in an instance voce ram~a, &c.; he helped himself to it (i. e. food). ― -b4- tanaAwalahu biAls~ayofi He reached, or hit him, with the sword: see nafaHahu: and see ta$aAwaluwA, and A^aTaf~a. ― -b5- huwa qariybu AlmutanaAwali and saholu AlmatanaAwali [app. He is one from whom it is easy to take, or receive, gifts, &c.]. (TA.) ― -b6- tanaAwaluwA Alr~imaAHa: see 6 in art. *wq. ― -b7- tanaAwalahu bimaA yasuww^uhu [He carped at him by saying, or taxed or charged him with, that which would grieve him]. ― -b8- tnAwlh bmA layosa fiyhi [He carped at him by saying, or taxed or charged him with, what was not in him]. (TA, voce AigotaAbahu.) ― -b9- tanaAwalahu bilisaAnihi He carped at him with his tongue: (IbrD:) as also naAlahu↓. (TA, art. hlb.) ― -b10- tnAwl $ayoy^FA It (a noun, &c.) applied to a thing. ― -b11- tanaAwala It comprehended, or comprised: post-classical in this sense, but commonly used. (MF, TA.) ― -b12- tanaAwalahu bimaA yukurahu He taxed or charged him with, or accused him of a thing disliked, or hated. See also art. nyl; see an explanation of AigotaAbahu, and see ZahorN.

naAlN *
naAlN: see nawaAlN.

nawaAlN *
nawaAlN and naAy^ilN↓ (S, K) and naAlN↓ (K) A gift: (S, K:) and a benefit, or favour, obtained from a man. (TA.) See two exs. of the first voce xiroqN: and an ex. of the second voce EarabapN. ― -b2- nawaAlN is also used as an inf. n. See an ex., from El-Aashà, voce layosa.

naAy^ilN *
naAy^ilN: see nawaAlN.

minowaAlN *
minowaAlN The web-beam of a loom; the beam on which the web is rolled, (S, Msb, in art. nwl, and S, K, voce Haf~apN,) as it is woven. (Msb.)

1 naAmato rijoluhu *
1. naAmato rijoluhu (assumed tropical:) I. q. xadirato [His leg, or foot, became benumbed, or torpid]. (TA in art. bsr.) ― -b2- naAma (assumed tropical:) It (a woman's anklet) ceased to sound, by reason of the fulness of the leg: like as one says [in the contr. case], AstyqZ. (TA in art. yqZ.) ― -b3- naAma has for its inf. ns. nawomN and manaAmN. (Msb.) ― -b4- naAma Alv~awobu i. q. raqada [q. v.] (A, art. rqd.) ― -b5- naAmati Als~uwqu i. q. raqadat [q. v.] (Th, in TA, art. rqd.) ― -b6- naAma (tropical:) He lay; as opposed to he sat and he stood. See naAy^imN. ― -b7- naAma Eano HaAjatihi He cared not for the object of his want, neglected it. (Msb.)

2 naw~ama *
2. naw~ama and A^anaAma↓ (assumed tropical:) It benumbed, or torpified: see naAmato rijoluhu.

3 naAwamotuhu fiY $iEaArK waAHidK *
3. naAwamotuhu fiY $iEaArK waAHidK [I slept with him in one under-garment]. (S, art. $Er.)

4 A^anoAama
4: see 2.

10 AisotanaAma A_ilyohi *
10. AisotanaAma A_ilyohi He trusted to him, and became quiet, or easy, in mind; relied upon him. (S, K.)

AimoraA^apN naw^uwmu AlD~uHaY *
AimoraA^apN naw^uwmu AlD~uHaY i. q. raquwdu AlDHY [which see]. (A, art. rqd.)

naAy^imN *
naAy^imN (tropical:) Lying; as opposed to sitting and standing. (Mgh.)

A^anowamu *
A^anowamu [More, or most, prone to sleep]. (A, art. fhd.)

manaAmN *
manaAmN Time of sleep. (Jel, xxxix. 43.) See also 1.

nawonapN *
nawonapN The dimple in the chin of a young child: (M, K:) see xunoEubapN, and qalotapN, and daAy^irapN, and 2 in art. dsm.

1 naAha bihi *
1. naAha bihi (Msb) and bihi naw~aha↓ (S, Mgh, Msb, K) He rendered famous (S, Mgh, Msb, K *) and magnified; (Msb;) and rendered notorious; (Mgh;) it, (S, Msb,) namely a person's name, (S,) or a thing, (Msb,) or him. (Mgh.)

2 naw~aha
2: see 1.

1 nawaAhu *
1. nawaAhu and AinotawaAhu↓ He intended it, purposed it, designed it, aimed at it, proposed it to himself as the object of his aim.

8 AinotawaY Alqawomu manozilFA bimawoDiEi ka*aA *
8. AinotawaY Alqawomu manozilFA bimawoDiEi ka*aA (S, Msb) The people, or party, repaired, or betook themselves, to, or towards, a place of alighting or abode, in such a place. (Msb.) See 1. ― -b2- AinotawaY It (a people, or company of men,) removed from country to country, or town to town. (TA.)

nawFY *
nawFY Date-stones: they are often used as food for camels; (see A_ibilN nawawiy~apN;) and for this purpose are bruised, and sometimes mixed with barley, and then moistened: see basiysapN. ― -b2- nawaApN What is cut off in the circumcision of a girl. (Lh, in TA, voce Eu*orapN.) The name shows that this is the prepuce of the clitoris, the end of which resembles the end of a date-stone. But see baZorN. ― -b3- Aln~awaY What remains of the place of circumcision of a girl after that operation; i. e. the baZor: (M:) or the place of circumcision of a girl, which is what remains of her baZor when the mutok has been cut off. (T.) ― -b4- nawFY Pieces of gold, each of the weight of five dirhems. (TA in art. jb.) ― -b5- nawFY The tract, or region towards which one goes (S) in journeying, whether near or distant; (S;) the place that is the object of a journey: (El-Kálee, TA:) [a traveller's destination:] the course, or direction, that one pursues (K, TA) in journeying and in acting or conduct: (TA:) see an ex. voce SarofN (third sentence), and Eaqara. It is of the fem. gender. (S.) See an ex. in some verses cited voce bayonN.

niY~N *
niY~N and naY~N: see art. nyA^.

niy~apN *
niy~apN An intention, an intent, a purpose, a design, an aim; a determination of the mind, or heart: (Msb, TA:) this is the general meaning: (Msb:) the direction that one takes (S, Msb, K) in a journey, (S, K,) near or distant, (S,) and in an action: (K:) the thing that one intends, or purposes, or aims at: an affair: (Msb:) the place to which one purposes journeying: (S in art. zl:) see an ex. from a rájiz in art. zl, first paragraph: the thing, or place, that one proposes to himself as the object of his aim, in an action, or a journey: or the thing, or place, that is the object of an action or journey: see Tiy~apN and $ul~apN. ― -b2- niy~apN naqaHN i. q. TaraHN and DrHN, &c. (O, art. DrH.) ― -b3- niy~apN baEiydapN: see baEydN, where the p of the latter word has been accidentally omitted. It also often (or generally) means A distant, or remote, thing, or place, that is the object of an action or journey: &c.

A^anaAmunotawK Eano ha*aA AlA^amori *
A^anaAmunotawK Eano ha*aA AlA^amori I. q. mataray~iEN, q. v. (TA in art. ryE.)

1 naAka AlmaTaru AlA^aroDa *
1. naAka AlmaTaru AlA^aroDa, and Aln~uEaAsu Eayonahu: see nakaHa.

1 naAla minohu *
1. naAla minohu He defamed him. (L, art. qbH.) ― -b2- naAla mino EiroDihi He defamed him. (T, K, TA.) ― -b3- naAl minohu He harmed, hurt, or injured him, namely, an enemy. (Mgh.) ― -b4- naAlahu bilisaAnihi is coupled in the Msb, art. qrS, with A^a*aAhu; and seems plainly to signify A^aSAabahu, which, in this case, is the same as A^a*aAhu. And tanaAwalahu↓ has a similar meaning. ― -b5- naAla He obtained, or attained. (S, K.) naAla mino Eaduw~ihi He attained [or obtained] the object of his aim, or desire, from his enemy. (Msb.) ― -b6- naAlahu, aor. yanaAlu, It reached him; came to him; syn. waSala A_ilayohi. (M, art. nyl.) See also Bd, xxii. 38. ― -b7- naAla laka A^ano nafoEala, aor. yaniylu; and laka A^anaAla↓: see A^anaY. ― -b8- naAlahu, first. pers. nilotahu, inf. n. nayolN, He obtained it; he attained it; namely, the object of his wish, &c. (S, K, Msb, &c.)

4 A^anoyala
4: see 1.

6 humaA yatanaAyalaAni * and yatanaAwalAani
6. humaA yatanaAyalaAni yatanaAwalAani signify the same. (TA.)

nayolN *
nayolN Obtainment; &c.: see 1.

A_inaAnapN *
A_inaAnapN The act of giving: (PS in art. nyl;) the giving a gift. (KL.) It seems properly to belong to art. nwl.

nayolN *
nayolN (T, M, K) and naAy^ilN↓ (M, K) What one obtains, or acquires, (T, M, K,) of the bounty of another; like nawaAla. (T.)
